Reviews.Title: Soild computer
Reviews.Author: R. Schwartz
Reviews.Content: I'm an IT contractor. This is a solidly built and well performing laptop. My wife liked it so much she got one too.

Reviews.Title: Nice screen size, nice placement of speakers, abysmally bad keyboard
Reviews.Author: Chip Dawes
Reviews.Content: I got this as a work computer replacing an X220.  This is a nice step up from the X220 in terms of screen size, memory capacity and disk size.  The speakers are a vast improvement over the X220 - they are aimed up (not down like the X220) so you can actually hear them.  The sound quality is crap compared to my 5 year old personally owned HP notebook, but its good for a Lenovo.  This is a workstation, not a media computer.ThinkPads have traditionally had the benefit of IBM's awesome keyboards - the best in the industry for touch typists.  However, this stinker is clearly not an IBM legacy.  The "Chicklets" style keyboard is terrible for a touch typist - you get NO feel for individual keys and the tactile feel is worse than the $15 Kensington USB keyboard I had lying around.The placement of the power button is another design faux pas - right next to the frequently used End, Insert and Delete keys - you quickly lean to save frequently.  This placement, when combined with the poor feel of the keyboard results in "oh crap" moments when you miss a key and hit power by mistake.Ergonomically the power button should have been placed near less frequently used keys - like the F9 or F10 key.Overall, it is a workstation with good capacity (screen size, CPU, memory and disk) but poor keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Solid product
Reviews.Author: Dennis J Woods "D Woods"
Reviews.Content: For one of my employees and it has handled everything we've thrown at it so far. Product was delivered well packaged an as advertised.

Reviews.Title: So So
Reviews.Author: supertechy
Reviews.Content: Not overly impressed, sold it and bought a T430 instead and much happier. T430 with same specs runs faster lol. This T530 has aluminum heatsink ribs but the T430 has copper ones. No brainer. Fan on this T530 ran a lot and noisy compared to the T430 which has a smaller fan mind you, quiet and less often on T430.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Lisa Dean
Reviews.Content: My son is considering a major in Engineering and the school he will attend recommended this computer.  It is a workhorse and has power and speed.  So far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Good basic machine
Reviews.Author: Nikk T. Fors
Reviews.Content: Does what I need a laptop to do for school and home use.  Use a T430 at work that inspired me to buy this for myself.

Reviews.Title: Bullseye!
Reviews.Author: Lance Holland "Just a guitar player..."
Reviews.Content: We've been looking to get a laptop for my wife for some time to replace her aging desktop.  She's always like the Thinkpad issued by my company because of the excellent screen, keyboard and sturdy construction.  We'd been holding out because we can't stand Windows 8 and there were few choices of laptops available with Windows 7.This laptop is just what we wanted.  I was delivered with almost no crapware that I needed to remove.  It has most of the same features of my $1K+ Thinkpad for a fraction of the price.  Actually, the only things it doesn't have are the fingerprint reader and the backlit keyboard.  Other than that, it's hard to tell the difference between the two machines.Anyway, this is the real deal.  It's a serious business laptop with quality construction and a REAL keyboard without the typical junk installed running on Windows 7.  Bullseye Lenovo!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Leonard Fuller
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, dose what I thought it should, easy to operate, fast processor.Worth the asking price, very reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: A Real Laptop
Reviews.Author: Robert Marker
Reviews.Content: The ThinkPad T530 continues the history of serious Professional machines. Rock solid and designed to do real work not play games!

Reviews.Title: SWEEEEEEEEET!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hesner
Reviews.Content: Replaced my Old ThinkPad with this one.Works great no problemsI would definitely upgrade RAMand add solid state drivebut the base unit is fineI have had this about a monthA very solid machine the last one went 4 years
